segments.text: How do you feel about wearing name logos or slogans on your clothing ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've never really thought about it before . I guess it doesn't bother me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you think advertising has an influence on the choices you make when you're shopping ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I guess so . I usually buy name-brand clothing , shoes , and electronic goods . How about you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I actually try to avoid name-brand items . I can't stand it when big companies advertise their products all over the place !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know that advertisers are experts at persuading people to spend their money , I think brilliant items are usually higher quality than ~ grounds .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think is sensible to buy products that is high quality than others when you want to buy something that's going to last a long time , but I don't think it always makes sense .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you have a brand preference for anything ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I do for shower items like shower gel and shampoo , but I don't for higher-end items .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What do you think about the " impossible is nothing " billboard on the high street ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's just a slogan for a famous company ; there's nothing really special about it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think it's a brilliant advert ! It really grabs my attention !
segments.speaker: S2
